title: 115_hr2112
content: The "Federal Government Decentralization Commission Act" establishes a commission within the General Services Administration to study and recommend the relocation of executive agencies outside the Washington metropolitan area. The Commission is tasked with submitting a plan to Congress for the relocation of recommended agencies or divisions. The Commission, established under the "Federal Government Decentralization Commission Act," consists of the Administrator of General Services and 10 members appointed by various leaders. Initial appointments must be made within 90 days of the Act's enactment, and vacancies do not affect the Commission's powers. The Commission members serve without pay and are allowed travel expenses. The Chairperson is the Administrator of General Services or a designee. The General Services Administration provides administrative and support staff for the Commission. The Commission submits a plan to Congress. The Commission must develop and submit a plan to Congress by September 30, 2019, for relocating executive agencies outside the Washington metropolitan area. The plan should identify new locations prioritized by low-income communities or areas with expertise in the agency's mission, consider national security implications, and include an economic impact study on the new location. The plan for relocating executive agencies outside the Washington metropolitan area must include a list of potential site acquisitions and a partial prospectus detailing the building description, location, and estimated cost of acquisition and relocation. SEC. 7. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, the term "executive agency" is defined as in section 105 of title 5, United States Code, excluding the Executive Office of the President. The term "low-income community" is defined as in section 45D(e) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The term "Washington metropolitan area" includes specific geographic areas within the District of Columbia, Maryland, and Virginia. SEC. 8. TERMINATION. The Commission will end 30 days after submitting the plan under section 6. SEC. 9. FUNDING. No new appropriations can be used for this Act.
